data.title: Great casual lunch spot
data.text: I love Panera because you can spend as long as you want here without feeling forced out. I saw many people with laptops working over lunch. My colleague and I had a quick lunch here while taking a break from the Battery Show at the SCS. I ordered the French onion soup - often I think restaurants make it too salty, but it was perfect. I love their baguettes. If you want a nice treat, pick up (and split!) one of their huge cinnamon rolls.

data.title: Our fav casual lunch place
data.text: We like the variety of soups and sandwiches and the fast but good food delivery.  If you have a sweet tooth the baked stuff is great and the bread is always good.

data.title: Way to go!
data.text: We used the app to order dinner to go. It was ready when we got there! Three of us ordered from the Pick Two menu. We took it home and ate on the patio. Perfect for our busy day! Loved the option. We will be using it again. The food was fresh and easy to eat. This would be great for a spontaneous picnic.

data.title: Good breakfast sandwiches
data.text: We went for breakfast. Good sandwiches made quickly and convenient. They offer a drive thru service. Store has easy access in Novi.

data.title: Fresh taste, very busy, well maintained
data.text:
My daughter and I stopped in for a quick dinner after prom dress shopping. 

We both ordered the pick 2; 1/2 sandwich with a cup of soup (total bill was $20.51, which also included an ice tea and water). I ordered the Steak & Arugula w/ Broccoli  Cheddar soup and she ordered the Bacon Turkey Bravo w/ Broccoli Cheddar soup. 

I really enjoyed mine; it was a very moist cold steak with onions soaked in what I thought to resemble an apple cider vinegar. Light greens with a sauce that was similar to a cross between horseradish and a light citrus taste. This with a tomato slice created a very light flavor combination. 

My daughter commented that her's was very good as well; a cold turkey sandwich topped with bacon, salt & pepper you could taste but was not overpowering, and a spicy mayo that almost had a relish/pickle flavor. 

The soup was just the right temperature, very creamy with a great flavor. Obviously continued broccoli, but also has maybe some carrots and a couple other veggies? The cheddar cheese was a definite flavor as well.

Some final side notes:

* Would for sure stop in again if in the area, totally would recommend 
* Love they put the calorie count on the menu board
* Very clean and well maintained
* Super busy but was able to see a few open tables
* Really cute outdoor seating area with tables
* Has a drive through
* Restrooms could have used a little attention; almost appear older

data.title: One of my favorites!!!
data.text: I really like to stop in at any Panera for coffee and to get some work done. While there I also like to order food, either breakfast or lunch. One of my favorites!!!

data.title: Warm soup and sandwiches on a winter day
data.text: It was everything you expect in a Panera Bread.  Soup and Sandwich were good.  Not enough seating on a Saturday lunch break.  Staff are friendly.

data.title: Always Good!
data.text: Can't resist going for breakfast or lunch - make it brunch. Friendly staff, quick service, never had a bad meal. It tends to get too crowded, though, so eating there is the only issue I have. Try going during off peak times.

data.title: Great service!
data.text:
The Service: Very efficient & friendly.

The Parking: Private lot 

Regular coffee are self-served. Price is very reasonable. The store is clean & well maintained. Great place for breakfast!!

data.title: Fresh Bread
data.text:
I know it is a chain.  I stopped in and ordered soup and a sandwich.  The sandwich I ordered had the freshest bread I have ever tasted.  It really was that good.  It was one of the sandwiches on the menu.  It was excellent.  I wish I had ordered a loaf of bread to take home.

I thought the bowl of chicken noodle soup was average.  It was OK but not great.  I ordered a brownie for desert and that was excellent too.

The service was excellent, friendly and fast.  They were very polite and nice.

I will definitely go back for another sandwich

data.title: Love it
data.text: Big fan of Panera bread and this location did not disappoint. Fast service.   Broth bowls and sandwiches are solid.  Salads fresh.

data.title: good soup, panini
data.text:
passing through Novi, MI, stopped at Panera's. got the autumn squash soup which was delicious with a pumpkin seed garnish. husband got the frontega chicken Panini and it was also very good. I love the rolls so we bought some to take home. for dessert we got carrot cake muffins - yummy. all in all this location is pretty good compared to some other locations we've been to. I will definitely return if in the area.
the one thing I don't like about Panera's everywhere is that people tend to set up camp there since they offer free wifi but I can't really blame panera's for that.

data.title: It's a chain.....
data.text: Of course they don't offer anything in gluten free.....what was I thinking??  Do like the free range chicken and soups.  Sometimes, too salty....ask for a sample before ordering.  Like the ability to customize items!!!

data.title: Menu
data.text: Good choices on their menu.   Wish they offered coffees.   Food is good.   Love their cinnamon bagel.  The best!

data.title: Always great food, quick service, good chai tea latte
data.text: The chai tea latte from Panera Bread is by far my favorite, and complemented with one of their baked goods is always a great combination. Stopped here while in town for a convention and needed lunch to take to the convention site. My chicken cobb salad was good, so was my wife's, although I don't think the PB&J sandwich for my son was that good. Mango smoothie and chai tea latte were delicious.

data.title: Breakfast spot
data.text: They have the best breakfast menu ever! The roasted turkey and tomato pesto is the bomb and the spinach and bacon sueflay is good too ( probably spelled that wrong).

data.title: Soups are great
data.text: Excellent soups, and drinks in general,  but sandwiches seem to have very thick bread.  They are still delicious, but I just feel bread is very thick.

data.title: Weak Internet
data.text: I was in during a non peak time and the Internet was excruciatingly slow. I have seen this phenomenon at a few other Paneras so it might be some incompatibility with their systems. But I have not encountered this at any other places. When you ask the employees they just shrug their shoulders. You would think with Internet access such a integral part of their business plan they would be able to address customers issues. Have to delete this place from my choices to office outside of my home.
